org.jooby.assets

Class AssetCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jooby.assets.AssetCompiler

  • public class AssetCompiler
extends Object

    Asset compiler

    Process static files by validate or modify them in some way.

    Since:
    0.11.0
    Author:
    edgar
    See Also:
    AssetProcessor, Assets

    • Method Detail

      • assets

        public List<String> assets(String name)
        Get all the assets for the provided file set. Example: 
         assets {
   fileset {
     home: [home.css, home.js]
   }
 }
        This method returns home.css and home.js for home file set. If there is no fileset under that name then it returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        name - Fileset name.
        Returns:
        List of files or empty list.

      • fileset

        public Set<String> fileset()
        Returns:
        Returns all the fileset.

      • patterns

        public Set<String> patterns()
        Iterate over fileset and common path pattern for them. Example: 
         {
   assets {
     fileset {
       lib: [js/lib/jquery.js],
       home: [css/style.css, js/home.js]
     }
   }
 }
        This method returns a set with /css/** and /js/** pattern.
        Returns:
        Path pattern of the entire fileset.

      • scripts

        public List<String> scripts(String fileset)
        Get all the javascript (or derived) for the provided fileset. Example: 
         {
   assets {
     fileset {
       mypage: [mypage.js, mypage.css]
     }
   }
 }

        This method returns mypage.js for mypage fileset.

        Parameters:
        fileset - Fileset name.
        Returns:
        All the scripts for a fileset.

      • styles

        public List<String> styles(String fileset)
        Get all the css files (or derived) for the provided fileset. Example: 
         {
   assets {
     fileset {
       mypage: [mypage.js, mypage.css]
     }
   }
 }

        This method returns mypage.js for mypage fileset.

        Parameters:
        fileset - Fileset name.
        Returns:
        All the scripts for a fileset.

      • pipeline

        public List<AssetProcessor> pipeline(String dist)
        List all the AssetProcessor for a distribution (a.k.a. environment).
        Parameters:
        dist - Distribution's name.
        Returns:
        A readonly list of available AssetProcessor.

      • aggregators

        public List<AssetAggregator> aggregators()
        Returns:
        Readonly list of available AssetAggregator.

      • build

        public Map<String,List<File>> build(String dist,
                                    File dir)
                             throws Exception
        Build assets using the given distribution and write output to the provided directory. Build process is defined as follow: 1. First, it runs all the aggregators (if any) 2. Then iterates each fileset and per each file in the fileset it apply the processor pipeline. 3. Finally, it merge all the files into one file and compressed/optimized if need it.
        Parameters:
        dist - Distribution's name (usually dev or dist).
        dir - Output directory.
        Returns:
        Map with fileset name as key and list of generated assets.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.

      • buildOne

        public File buildOne(String filename,
                     File dir)
              throws Exception
        Apply the processor pipeline to the given asset. Like build(String, File) but for a single file or asset.
        Parameters:
        filename - Asset to build.
        Returns:
        Processed asset.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.

      • summary

        public String summary(Map<String,List<File>> result,
                      Path outDir,
                      String dist,
                      long duration,
                      String... extraInfo)
        Print a summary of the given results.
        Parameters:
        result - Compilation result.
        outDir - Output directory.
        dist - Distribution (dev or prod).
        duration - Execution time in millis.
        extraInfo - Additional information.
        Returns:
        Summary.
